As a former public health official, I know the critical role our public officials play in combating potential epidemics. I’m glad we were able to come together to get this emergency supplemental passed and hope my colleagues in the Senate are soon to follow.

This bill provides important funding that allows the Administration to address the virus at home and abroad, including expediting vaccine development, purchasing essential equipment and supplies, and assisting state and local health departments.

Today I voted to approve over $7 billion in emergency funding for the U.S. response to the Coronavirus as well as extending emergency telehealth services. This legislation is the product of a bipartisan compromise to address this emergency.
